result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corey L Gransberry

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski and Patrick Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

At the hour of 2:09 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.

"We, the jury, find the defendant, Corey Gransberry, GUILTY of Attempted Robbery, as charged in count 1 of the Information."
"We, the jury, find the defendant, Corey Gransberry, GUILTY of Attempted First Degree Intentional Homicide as a Party to a Crime, as charged in the Information."

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. At the hour of 2:15 pm jury dismissed for the day. 

State requests that since defense did not make any motions at the close of the state's case that if motion was made that Court place ruling on the record.  For reasons stated on the record, Court places ruling on the record.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict. Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court ordered the defendant REMANDED for sentencing. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski and Patrick Franken in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Trial discussions held. Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waived right. Jury in box: 9:34 am. Sworn for the state: Shwatiki M. 

State rests. Defense rests. State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 11:21 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Urbaniak and Mahan who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Exhibit discussions held regarding on record. Case passed for deliberations.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski and Patrick Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. Sidebars placed on the record. 
Testimony continued. Previously sworn for the state: MPD Detective Thaddues Schimmels. Court takes break. Jury out of box: 3:32 pm. Break taken. Jury in box: 3:52 pm. 

Sworn for the state: MPD forensic investigator Yvette Paniel, MPD latent print examiner, MPD Detective Steven Jegen, MPD Detective Joshua Nemeth.

Court releases panel for the evening. Court advises not to speak, research or look-up the case. Case adjourned in Branch 4.

Exhibits 1 to 71 received.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski and Patrick Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Trial discussions held. Jury in box: 9:21 am. Sworn for the state: MPD Officer Benjamin Marshman. State requests break. Court grants. Jury out box: 10:01 am. Witness Christian B. takes stands. Sworn in: Christian B. State motions for immunity for testimony. Court holds colloquy with witness regarding immunity offer and testifying. Court orders witness to testify truthfully. 

Jury in box: 10:16 am. Sworn for the state: Christian B. 
Sworn for the state: Boubacar K. Sworn as interpreter( French): Paula L. for sworn witness.  
Sworn for the state: MPD Detective Michael Lees, MPD Forensic Investigator Bryan Miller, MPD Detective Thaddeus Schimmels. Court breaks for lunch. Jury out of box: 11:58 am. Case passed until afternoon.

Exhibits 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin along with Attorney Patrick Franken. Case in Court for jury trial. Jury panel in court and sworn. Voir dire proceeds at the hour of 2:00PM. 

Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause are selected. Jurors out of the box at 3:56PM for a break. Court in recess.

Case back on the record out of the presence of the jury. Parties do no object to the panel as selected. Jurors back in the box at 4:16PM. Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impaneled and sworn. Court instructed jury. Jurors released for the evening at the hour of 4:41PM and instructed to return at 8:45AM tomorrow. Court places strikes on the record. 

Jury list received and filed.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry not in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin along with Attorney Patrick Franken. Case in court for jury trial first call. Speedy trial demand has been filed on this case. Parties advise the Court they are ready for trial. Discussion held. Case passed until 9:45AM to address the remainder of the Court's calendar. 

Case in court for jury trial second call: Defendant appears with Attorney Patrick Flanagan. Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin along with Attorney Patrick Franken. Discussion held as to posture of the case. Parties are still prepared for trial. State placed offer on the record to which Defendant rejects. Case passed. Parties advised to return at 1:30PM. 

Case in court for jury trial third call: Same appearances as second call. Court informs the parties this case has been selected for trial. Case proceeds to Jury Trial.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin. State requests adjournment of jury trial. Defense objecting to adjournment. Court grants adjournment request. Parties agree upon next jury trial date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Notice of Motion to Adjourn, filed.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court for Corey L Gransberry.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, defendant Corey L Gransberry not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense filed demand for speedy trial. Court sets final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Parties contact to reschedule case to 7-29-2022 8:30 am. Parties notified.
EXPIRES 10-24-2022

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court with Attorney Patrick Flanagan.  Defendant Corey L Gransberry in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective T. Schimmels. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Flanagan in court, appear in person. Defendant Corey L Gransberry not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Due to assignment of Assistant District Attorney, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Hanrahan Br. 04. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed.

Court ordered no contact with Chandra F., Benjamin M., Jamar T.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Corey L Gransberry in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Corey L Gransberry in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
